steps.title: Get a Pokémon egg by leaving two Pokémon in the same egg group or a non-legendary Pokémon with ditto.
steps.content: Get a Pokémon egg by leaving two Pokémon in the same egg group or a non-legendary Pokémon with ditto. Every 255 steps there is a chance your Pokémon have laid an egg.

steps.title: Get a Pokémon with the ability Magma Armor or Flame Body.
steps.content: Get a Pokémon with the ability Magma Armor or Flame Body. Slugma, Magcargo, Magby, Magmar, Magmortar Litwick, Lampent, Chandelure, Larvesta, and Volcarona have these abilities. Litwick and its evolutions may have Flash Fire as an ability, so check to make sure for them.

steps.title: Put the Pokémon with Flame Body or Magma Armor in your party.
steps.content: Put the Pokémon with Flame Body or Magma Armor in your party. Magma Armor halves the number of egg cycles, and Flame Body halves the number of steps needed for the egg to hatch, thus making egg hatching more efficient.

steps.title: Hatch the Pokémon egg by running around.
steps.content: Hatch the Pokémon egg by running around. Use a fast bike and cycle up and down somewhere with a long stretch of open ground. Use the Mauville breeding line in Hoenn, the Solaceon breeding line in Sinnoh and the Cycling Road in Kanto. You can tell the egg's progress in hatching by checking its summary.

steps.title: Find a mudslide.
steps.content: Find a mudslide.

steps.title: Use the Acro Bike to try to go up it.
steps.content: Use the Acro Bike to try to go up it. Every time you fail you have taken one step. You can sit there with a weight on the forward button and it will hatch before you know it! Unfortunately, this error has been rectified in Emerald, so you'll have to use the Mauville breeding line. But, this was untouched in Gen IV games, so good luck!

steps.title: Go to the Fuego Ironworks near Floaroma Town.
steps.content: Go to the Fuego Ironworks near Floaroma Town.

steps.title: Find a place where the slide tiles face the wall.
steps.content: Find a place where the slide tiles face the wall.

steps.title: Position your character next to the wall then hold down the direction button that sends your character to the slide tile with a rubber band or bulldog clip.
steps.content: Position your character next to the wall then hold down the direction button that sends your character to the slide tile with a rubber band or bulldog clip. Leave this for as long as necessary.

steps.title: Get a Ditto.
steps.content: Get a Ditto. It doesn't matter what gender the Pokémon is. Ditto breeds with everything because of its transforming ability.

steps.title: Place the Ditto and the other Pokémon you wish to breed within the daycare on Route 7.
steps.content: Place the Ditto and the other Pokémon you wish to breed within the daycare on Route 7.

steps.title: Find Froufrou palace.
steps.content: Find Froufrou palace. There will be a courtyard nearby. Using your bicycle, ride around the courtyard and go back to the daycare to obtain your egg.

steps.title: Go back to the courtyard and ride around until the egg hatches.
steps.content: Go back to the courtyard and ride around until the egg hatches.

steps.title: Acquire a Pokémon Egg.
steps.content: Acquire a Pokémon Egg. To hatch a Pokémon Egg in Pokémon Go, you need to find one first. To find an Egg, walk to your nearest PokéStop and activate it by spinning the medal that appears in its centre. A number of items will appear, and one may be an Egg, if not you can try again with another PokéStop. Or you can collect 7k eggs from opening gifts your friends sent you! To open a gift, go to your profile on the bottom left corner of the screen and then tap friends; there will be a list of friends. You can sort them by gift and simply tap on the ones that have sent you one, then tap on the gift to open it!

steps.title: Check how long the Egg will take to hatch.
steps.content: Check how long the Egg will take to hatch. Once you have an egg, you want to know how long it'll take you to hatch it once it's incubated. To do this: Open your items by pressing the PokéBall on the bottom of the screen. Tap the "Pokémon" button. Tap "Eggs" in the top-right corner. Find your Egg and tap on it. On the screen, the Egg will display as either 2km, 5km, 7k or 10km. This tells how far you need to travel in order to hatch the Egg (in kilometres).

steps.title: Incubate the egg.
steps.content: Incubate the egg. Once you have your Egg, you must incubate it to hatch it. You can do this either using the Incubator you receive at the beginning of the game, or by buying more in the PokéShop. To incubate your egg: Navigate to your Eggs as described above. Tap on the Egg you wish to hatch. Select "Incubate" to begin the incubation process.

steps.title: Travel the distance specified on the egg.
steps.content: Travel the distance specified on the egg. If your egg is a 5km egg, you will need to travel 5km to hatch it. So, get walking, jogging, skateboarding, or cycling! After you have travelled this distance, you will see a screen that says "Oh?" and your Pokémon will hatch! [1] X Research source You must travel the distance specified with the app open. You cannot incubate your egg while travelling faster than 20mph. Pay attention to your surroundings while travelling with the app open. The longer the distance required, the rarer the Pokémon.

steps.title: Incubate another Egg once one Egg hatches.
steps.content: Incubate another Egg once one Egg hatches. When the Egg you were incubating hatches, your Incubator will continue to "deteriorate." Make the most of your Incubator by putting another egg into it as soon as possible. To hatch multiple eggs at once, you can purchase additional Incubators at the shop.

steps.title: Put the egg in your party.
steps.content: Put the egg in your party.

steps.title: Head to the small fenced-in area with the hay bales directly across from the Pokémon Nursery on foot.
steps.content: Head to the small fenced-in area with the hay bales directly across from the Pokémon Nursery on foot.

steps.title: Once in there get on Tauros and use the circle pad to spin around in circles while holding down the B button.
steps.content: Once in there get on Tauros and use the circle pad to spin around in circles while holding down the B button. This is the quickest way to hatch an egg.

steps.title: Or you can just keep it in your party while you walk from place to place if you're in no hurry.
steps.content: Or you can just keep it in your party while you walk from place to place if you're in no hurry.

steps.title: Visit the Pokémon Daycare on Route 3 and collect an egg from the woman standing outside.
steps.content: Visit the Pokémon Daycare on Route 3 and collect an egg from the woman standing outside.

steps.title: Add the egg to your party.
steps.content: Add the egg to your party.

steps.title: Walk or bike a pre-determined amount of steps depending on the species of Pokémon.
steps.content: Walk or bike a pre-determined amount of steps depending on the species of Pokémon.

steps.title: Once the "Oh?"
steps.content: Once the "Oh?" textbox appears, press A to hatch the egg.
